newsitem.title: NEW ZEALAND: Survey shows NZers want portable numbers - Clear.
newsitem.headline: Survey shows NZers want portable numbers - Clear.

text.p: Clear Communications said a survey it released on Tuesday showed there was strong public support for portability of phone numbers.
CEO Andrew Makin said 46 percent of residential customers and 45 percent of businesses said they would change telephone suppliers if they could retain their number.
"It shows there is considerable demand for choice," he told a news conference.
Clear has been battling rival phone company Telecom Corp over the issue.
Makin said the issue was a consumer one, not a competition issue and a very large impediment to choice that was not related to service or pricing issues.
Telecom sees it as a competition issue.
Makin said that without portability of numbers Clear would not enter the residential market.
"It's the biggest single barrier to competition in the residential market and it is easy to fix."
He said in every other country telephone numbers were owned by the government like radio spectrum.
Phone companies had been talking about the issue for four years and making little progress. Clear was calling on the government to regulate on the issue.
"What we are after is a set of ground rules for implementing portability."
He rejected legal redress as a remedy. It was too slow, he said.
